CSSSymbols.summary: The symbols() CSS function enables defining counter styles inline, directly as a value of properties such as list-style, providing a less powerful but simpler alternative to the @counter-style method of defining a counter style.

remarks.para: Unlike @counter-style, which defines a reusable counter style, symbols() is anonymous (i.e., it can only be used once). This function accepts strings and images as values. In comparison, the @counter-style's symbols descriptor also accepts identifiers.

-@counter-style descriptors: @counter-style/system, @counter-style/symbols, @counter-style/additive-symbols, @counter-style/prefix, @counter-style/suffix, @counter-style/range, @counter-style/pad, @counter-style/speak-as, @counter-style/fallback
-List style properties: list-style, list-style-type
-CSS counter styles module
-CSS lists and counters module
